intro: Phymatopsis yakuinsularis, commonly known as the Yaku Island phymatopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yaku Islands in Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
